summary: Internal email correspondence from July 23, 2019, regarding an incident involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The document describes Epstein being found with marks on his neck, placed on suicide watch, and his claim that his cellmate attempted to kill him. It includes medical and psychological assessments and discusses plans for his housing.

connections.description: The Operations Lieutenant responded to the incident involving Epstein and initiated his placement in restraints and suicide watch.
The Physician Assistant conducted a medical assessment of Epstein following the incident, documenting his physical condition and statements.

events.title: Epstein Incident at MCC New York
events.description: Epstein was found lying on the floor in a fetal position in the Special Housing Unit with red marks on his neck. He claimed his cellmate attempted to kill him. He was placed in hand restraints, escorted to a suicide cell, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Medical Assessment of Epstein
events.description: A Physician Assistant medically assessed Epstein at 6:30 a.m., noting erythema on his neck and knee. Epstein was ambulatory, oriented, smiling, and claimed not to know what happened or how he got the marks.

events.title: Psychological Assessment of Epstein
events.description: A Psychologist evaluated Epstein at 9:10 a.m. and determined he should remain on suicide watch for further observation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with red marks on his neck and claimed his cellmate had attempted to kill him.
Epstein was placed on suicide watch following the incident, with medical and psychological assessments conducted.
The medical assessment noted a circular line of erythema at the base of his neck but no significant injuries, and Epstein denied knowing how the marks occurred.
Corrections staff were reviewing his case for placement in the general population in Unit 7 South and seeking an appropriate cellmate.
The document reflects internal confusion and a request for a clearer memo to be forwarded to higher authorities (IPPA and the Director).
